Title:
Diversification process of the genus Platycerus Geoffroy
(Coleoptera: Lucanidae) in Japan based on nuclear and mitochondrial
genes
Keywords:
28S rRNA, COI, divergence time, introgressive
hybridization, maximum likelihood analysis, Bayesian analysis
Abstract:
Molecular phylogenies of the genus Platycerus in Japan
based on the nuclear 28S ribosomal RNA and mitochondrial cytochrome
oxidase subunit I (COI) genes were characterized. These analyses,
combined with our previous morphological information, revealed a
detailed diversification process of Platycerus in Japan, and estimates
of their divergence times. Introgression of the COI gene was also
discovered in some species. From this data, it was inferred that the
genetic divergence of Platycerus has occurred intensely in southwestern
Japan.
